_id.description:
id of the contract from placements.
placements.programmes.contracts._id

placement.description: ID of the placement in placements collection.

programme.description:
ID of the programme in placements collection.

programmes._id

sections.description:
A section of the contract representing a specific partition of the overall risk to be insured. A contract section can be based upon the contract type (e.g. insurance/reinsurance), coverage (e.g. class of business) and/or layer (limit of liability).
The recursive relationship captures the relationship between a section and its sub-sections.

LDM Ref: Section

_id.description:
ID of the section in placements collection.

programmes.contracts.sections._id

default.description: Field indicating whether this is a default section, e.g. there are no section details, it is an empty container.

creation_date.description: The date at which the entity was created.

creation_channel.description: Channel used to make the entity, e.g. OutSystems.

creation_user.description: _id of the user creating the entity.

modified_date.description: The date at which the change was made.

modified_channel.description: Channel used to make the change, e.g. OutSystems.

modified_user.description: _id of the user making the change.

classification_description.description: A description of the classification type as supplied by the Broker.

treaty_or_facultative_type.description:
The code that represents whether the section is a Treaty or Facultative for a reinsurance agreement, or Direct for an insurance agreement.

proportional_type.description:
The code that represents whether the section is a Proportional or Non-Proportional Treaty agreement.

cover_description.description: A description that represents the cover type. Represents a subset of cover type at section level.

contract_parties.description: A collection of individuals or organisations, and their relationship within the contract of insurance.

agency_type.description: The code that represents the type to identify an individual or organisation.

agency_description.description: A description to identify the agency type, where an existing type code is not within the agency code codelist.

agency_code.description: The code that represents the identify an individual or organisation, for the codeset used.

The code that represents the contractual role that a particular individual or organisation is involved in, under the terms of a contract of insurance.

addresses.description: A collection of address attributes relating of a Party.

street_number.description: The address number and street for a single address of a Party.

city.description: The city for a single address of a Party.

postcode.description: The zip code or postal code for a single address of a Party.

country_subdivision_code.description: The code that represents the country subdivision of an address location for a Party.

country_code.description: The code that represents the country of an address location for a Party.

contacts.description: A collection of contact attributes relating to a Party.

name.description: The full name of a contact.

telephone_number.description: The telephone number of a contact.

email.description: The email address of the contact.

references.description: A collection of references relating to a Party.

applies_to.description:
The code that represents the level at which a reference is applicable to.

---

LDM ref: TBD

value.description: The value of the reference applicable to the Party.

lst_location.description: A description of the location where only a Local Standard Time value is provided for a time zone.

estimated_dates_indicator.description:
Indicates whether the period dates supplied are estimated (Y) or not (N).

NOTE: As part of ART055, this field was changed from a boolean into a string due to a OutSystems limitation: it does not differ between not filling the field and filling as false. For this field, we want 3 possible states:

 - Yes: field populated as "Y"
 - No: field populated as "N"
 - Not defined: field does not exist

event_description.description: A description that details what the estimated event or trigger is.

cancellation_provisions_description.description: A description detailing information relating to provisions for cancelling the contract.

coinsurance_share.description: The share of the risk that the policyholder agrees to bear between them and the re/insurer.

cover_operating_basis.description: A collection of data attributes relating to the operating basis of cover.

basis_type_codes.description:
A list of code that represent the basis for when claims can be made.

---

LDM ref: TBD

basis_description.description: A description of the basis for when claims can be made.

retroactive_date.description: The date after which the event triggering the claim must have happened for the claim to be included in the cover provided.

continuity_date.description: The date after which knowledge of the loss must have arisen for the claim to be included in the cover provided.

litigation_date.description: The date after which claims must be raised or litigation commenced for the claim to be included the cover provided.

multiple_settlement_details.description:
Indicates whether there are multiple settlement due dates (Y) or a single settlement due date (N).

NOTE: As part of ART055, this field was changed from a boolean into a string due to a OutSystems limitation: it does not differ between not filling the field and filling as false. For this field, we want 3 possible states:

 - Yes: field populated as "Y"
 - No: field populated as "N"
 - Not defined: field does not exist

settlement_details.description: A collection of attributes defining the instalments breakdown applicable to the Contract or Section.

sequence_number.description: The instalment number allocated by the enumerator sequence of each instalment.

currency_code.description: The 3-character code that represents the currency in ISO 4217 standard.

amount.description: The amount of the premium within this instalment.

rate.description: The percentage of the premium within this instalment.

due_date.description: The date when this instalment is due.

payment_terms.description: A description for any premium payment terms, warranties or conditions.

exchange_rates.description: A collection of contractual exchange rates, where a fixed exchange rate between the premium and settlement currency applies.

contract_currency_code.description: The 3-character code that represents the currency in ISO 4217 standard.

exchange_currency_code.description: The 3-character code that represents the currency in ISO 4217 standard.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate represented as the conversion rate from the reference (i.e. premium) currency to the target (i.e. settlement) currency.

regulatory_provisions.description: A collection of regulatory provisions under the terms of a contract of insurance.

classifications.description: A collection of regulatory classifications of the Party under the terms of a contract of insurance.

year_of_account.description: The year of account to which any premium payment for this Contract or Section is allocated to. This is usually required on risks where the contract period exceeds 18 months.

percentage.description: The percentage of the total premium that is deemed to be the allocation of covering a particular risk code given a year of account.

risk_locations.description: A collection of data items to represent the accounting year allocations for a Contract or Section.

country_code.description: The 2-character code that represents the country in ISO 3166-1 standard.

country_subdivision_code.description: The code that represents the country subdivision in ISO 3166-2 standard.

Indicates whether the contract has arisen from a distance marketing campaign (Y) or not (N).

NOTE: As part of ART055, this field was changed from a boolean into a string due to a OutSystems limitation: it does not differ between not filling the field and filling as false. For this field, we want 3 possible states:

 - Yes: field populated as "Y"
 - No: field populated as "N"
 - Not defined: field does not exist

The code that represents the distribution channel that the business was acquired by.

value.description: The value of the reference applicable to the Party.

subjectivities.description: The Subjectivity information, identifying the Subjectivity itself, the status of cover prior to its agreement/satisfaction and any deadline applied to satisfy.

sequence_number.description: The Subjectivity number allocated by the enumerator sequence of each Subjectivity.

description.description: A description of the Subjectivity and any associated terms.

due_date.description: The date and timestamp by which the Subjectivity needs to be met.

terms_until_satisfied_description.description: A description of the terms applicable until the Subjectivity has been met.

consequences_description.description: A description of the terms applicable when the Subjectivity has not been met.

choice_law.description: A description of the law that will apply in the event of a dispute between the policyholder and (re)insurer as defined in the Contract or Section.

choice_jurisdiction.description: A description of the court that will have jurisdiction in the event of a dispute between the policyholder and (re)insurer as defined in Contract or Section.

disruptive_resolution_clause.description: A description of how the parties will resolve disputes when a court is not chosen for resolving disputes between contractual parties.

service_suit_clause.description: A description where the service of suit nominee is the party who is authorised or nominated by the parties involved to accept service of legal proceedings on their behalf.

choice_law_jurisdiction.description: A collection of attributes that define the choice of law, jurisdiction, dispute resolution or service of suit clauses.

taxes.description: A collection of data items that represent any tax(es) that are applied under the terms of the insurance Contract or Section.

category_type.description:
The code that represents the category type of the tax.

name_type_code.description:
The code that represents the name type of the tax.

country_code.description: The 2-character code that represents the country in ISO 3166-1 standard.

country_subdivision_code.description: The code that represents the country subdivision in ISO 3166-2 standard.

tax_location.description: A collection of data items to identify the tax territory of cover for a Contract or Section.

calculation_type.description:
The code that represents the type of calculation to apply to the tax.

fixed_currency_code.description: The 3-character code that represents the currency in ISO 4217 standard.

fixed_amount.description: The fixed amount applicable for the tax.

base_currency_code.description: The 3-character code that represents the currency in ISO 4217 standard.

base_amount.description: The base amount applicable to the tax calculation.

multiplier.description: The base multiplier to be applied to the tax calculation.

withholding_reduction.description:
Indicates whether the tax amount has a withholding reduction factor applicable to it (Y) or not (N).

NOTE: As part of ART055, this field was changed from a boolean into a string due to a OutSystems limitation: it does not differ between not filling the field and filling as false. For this field, we want 3 possible states:

 - Yes: field populated as "Y"
 - No: field populated as "N"
 - Not defined: field does not exist

The list of codes that represents the basis of the tax.

fixed_basis_description.description: A description of the tax basis type, where not provisioned under the existing reference data basis type codes.

inception_time.description:
The time on which the (re)insurance contract comes into force.

Inception time is saved separately so that we can save the API updates. If we store this time element in the inception date field, when the inception date is updated in NextGen, it will overwrite the time element (since the UI does not show the time element at the moment).

---

LDM Ref: Section.Inception Time

inception_timezone.description:
The time zone in which the (re)insurance contract comes into force.

The inception date always store in +UTC, but the inception date should always be saved as the date converted to the timezone expressed in this field.

---

LDM Ref: Section.Inception Time Zone

expiry_time.description:
The time on which the (re)insurance contract ceases cover.

Expiry time is saved separately so that we can save the API updates. If we store this time element in the expiry date field, when the expiry date is updated in NextGen, it will overwrite the time element (since the UI does not show the time element at the moment).

---

LDM Ref: Section.Expiry Time

expiry_timezone.description:
The time zone on which the (re)insurance contract ceases cover.

The expiry date always store in +UTC, but the expiry date should always be saved as the date converted to the timezone expressed in this field.

---

LDM Ref: Section.Expiry Time Zone

claims_agreement_type.description:
The set of codes that represents the basis of any claims agreement.

---

LDM Ref: Section.ClaimsAgreementType

claims_agreement_description.description: A description representing the basis of any claims agreement.
